name: Zombeer (itch) (thewalkingdrunk)
description:
The Cloudy Night! This is how the night it all began became known. Much of the population has turned into terrifying zombies that in their insatiable hunger have devoured another large part of it. The survivors take refuge in the bars where they were and after deep analysis they concluded that what’s saved them was the fact they are all consumers of a particular type of craft beer. That's what saved their humanity ! So, they decided to keep drinking this beer just to be sure. And for that, they will count on Steven, a brave and clever pizza deliveryman who will risk his neck to delivery the craft beer.

The game begins with the brewer summoning Steven to save humanity. At each stage, Steven will get a mission: the amount of beer and the place of delivery. He must annihilate the zombies along the way to his destination. For this, Steven will only rely on a beerthrower and some explosive beers to attack the creatures.

History

Zombeer is a project of a group of brazilian indie game developers, called The Walking Drunk. The project was born to compete in the 9th APDJ Game Marathon and later commercialization.

As the team's first commercially developed game, it was designed with the Concentric Scopes strategy, that is, to publish a fully playable and complete version, but with potencial for many content additions and refinements.

With version 1 presented in the APDJ academic environment on October 6, 2019, it is estimated that the release of version 1.2 on Steam, the first commercial version, will take place on December 5, 2019.

Features

  • Single Player action-shooter with 3 maps and more than 50 missions.
  • Power-ups that can give a better chance to win.
  • 4 kinds of weapons upgradeable.
  • A differentiated aiming system.
  • Hordes of zombies in 3 stages of involution and dangerous humans to defeat.
  • Different AIs for each type of enemy.
  • An angled 2D top view.
  • A current and humorous thematic.
  • Original illustrations by Lucas Heinen.
  • Original soundtrack by Denner Hall.
